thread.title: 2nd airman confirmed dead following parachute training accident at Eglin Air Force Base, Fla. - @AirForceTimes
thread.title_full: 2nd airman confirmed dead following parachute training accident at Eglin Air Force Base, Fla. - @AirForceTimes

author: Tricia McDermott
title: 2nd airman confirmed dead following parachute training accident at Eglin Air Force Base, Fla. - @AirForceTimes
text:
Second airman dies from parachute accident By Jeff Schogol, Staff writer 2:03 p.m. EDT August 4, 2015 A soldier from the New Jersey National Guard's Honor Guard holds a folded flag. (Photo: Tech. Sgt. Matt Hecht/Air National Guard) 34 CONNECT 44 TWEET 1 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A second airman has died from injuries during a parachute training accident Monday at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida. 
Both airmen served with the 24th Special Operations Wing. Their names are expected to be released later Tuesday. 
The accident happened during “routine military freefall training,” according to a 24th Special Operations Wing news release, which did not provide details of what went wrong. Both airmen were rushed to local hospitals. 
The Associated Press initially reported on Monday that one airman died and the second was in critical condition. On Tuesday, the 24th SOW announced that both airmen died of injuries sustained in the accident. 
Investigators are looking into what caused the accident, the news release said. Read or Share this story: http://militari.ly/1N7CAjg More Stories
